ca.mcgill.ecse211.dpmfinalprojectteam3

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.dpmfinalprojectteam3.Navigation

  • public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is an updated version from lab 3 where we changed most methods in order to match lab 4, used when we need to travel to a specific coordinate Also use for other operations such as flag search an zip traversal. How the robot travels the grid, based on what is passed into the constructor
    Version:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • startNav

        public void startNav()
        Start nav,

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double endX,
                     double endY)
        Travel to, orients the robot to x and y on the grid calls turn to if the robot is not aligned in the proper position to reach x and y. If using start nav method, will continuously call this method until no more coordinates in the path
        Parameters:
        endX - x coordinate of the destination
        endY - y coordinate of the destination

      • driveWithoutAvoid

        public void driveWithoutAvoid(double distanceToTravel)
        Drive without avoid, called if neglecting avoidance WILL NOT USE THIS METHOD IN FINAL PROJECT SINCE NEED TO ACCOUNT FOR AVOIDING
        Parameters:
        distanceToTravel, - how far the robot needs to travel to reach destination

      • drive

        public void drive(double distanceToTravel,

        Drive, accounts for avoiding as well
        Parameters:
        distanceToTravel - the distance to travel
        endX - the end X
        endY - the end Y

      • Avoid

        public void Avoid(double endX,
                  double endY)
        Avoid, called by drive if the US sensor reads a value that is smaller than the bandcenter
        Parameters:
        endX - the end X
        endY - the end Y
